word: That man is unfit to be the president of a conference or a leader among God's people who has not broad ideas and views.  It is the privilege and duty of those who bear responsibilities in the cause to become learners in Christ's school.  The professed follower of Christ must not follow the dictates of his own will; his mind must be trained to think Christ's thoughts, and enlightened to comprehend the will and way of God.  Such a believer will be a learner of Christ's methods of work.--Letter 276, 1907, pp. 1, 2 (Sept. 5, 1907 to J. A. Burden).
